full_summary:
**Building Condition Report - Various Sites in New Brunswick**
==========================

[Status: Expired]
-----------------

### Tender Information

* **Reference Number:** WS3796317947-Doc3819425546
* **Solicitation Number:** WS3796317947
* **Publication Date:** January 11, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** January 24, 2023, at 14:00 (Eastern Standard Time)
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** January 20, 2023

### Description

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites bids to develop building condition reports for four locations in New Brunswick. The objective of the report is to provide a comprehensive assessment of the building's condition.

### Eligible Bidder Information

Pre-qualified firms under the Architectural Supply Arrangement E0225-15229 are eligible to participate in this tender. The following firms have been pre-qualified:

* Eastpoint Architecture Partners
* Lydon Lynch Architects Ltd.
* Coles Associates Ltd.

### Submission Requirements

Bidders must submit their proposals in SAP Ariba. For more information, please contact the procurement officer identified below.

### Procurement Officer Information

* **Name:** Rachel Miller (SPAC/PSPC)
* **Email:** [rachel.miller@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:rachel.miller@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Additional Information

Procurement Canada has excluded bidders from using any privately qualified architect or engineer not registered with Federal Centre for Information Services in any public building or structure.

### Trade Agreements

This tender opportunity is covered by the following trade agreements:

* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

Please Note
----------

The information provided in this entry is based on data available to me. Any errors or discrepancies should be directed to the relevant government agency or the contractor. All fields or features are free to use. I am not responsible for any implications of the data contained within.
I hope it looks much better now. Thank you for sharing this assignment with me!§
